intro: Sedum maximowiczii, commonly known as the rock sedum, is a succulent plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Sedum maximowiczii is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
